snippet: Suggestions that a former detainee sent to Uruguay may have crossed the border into Brazil have prompted concerns on releasing detainees to other countries....
abstract: Vanishing of former Guantanamo Bay prisoner Jihad Diyab, Syrian detainee who was transferred to Uruguay in 2014, is raising Congressional concerns; Uruguayan officials suggest he may have crossed largely unguarded border into Brazil; House committee is preparing to hold oversight hearing concerning policies allowing release of detainees to other countries.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and SIMON ROMERO
byline.contributor: Charlie Savage reported from Washington and Simon Romero reported from Rio de Janeiro. Jonathan Gilbert contributed reporting from Buenos Aires.

lead_paragraph: Suggestions that a former detainee sent to Uruguay may have crossed the border into Brazil have prompted concerns on releasing detainees to other countries.

headline.main: Disappearance of ex-Guantánamo Bay Prisoner Raises Alarms
headline.print_headline: Ex-Guantánamo Bay Prisoner Disappears, Raising Concerns
